availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patrick O'Bannon Hawes (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John W. Hawes and Lydia Hawes. Married to Amelia M. Hampton Hawes in Boyd County, Kentucky on October 21, 1863. Graduated from Asbury University in June 1860. Attorney in Louisville, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Second Lieutenant from June 12, 1862 to November 1, 1862. Served in the 14th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as First Lieutenant from November 1, 1862 to May 12, 1863. Served in the 14th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from March 14, 1863 to January 31, 1865. Noted as having served in the 45th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Second Lieutenant from September 25, 1863 to September 25, 1863, but mustered out the same day he was mustered in, listed as a supernumerary officer.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 1, p. 370.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Boyd County Marriages, Film #000344011, p. 586 of microfilm.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 274.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 437.
"Many Louisville Friends. Patrick O'Bannon Hawes, Who Died in Omaha Tuesday,"The Courier-Journal(Louisville, Ky), May 6, 1898, p. 10.
